description: Dive into "Valencia's Enchanted Escapes for Two" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Valencia's Enchanted Escapes for Two

places.generalDescription: The Mercat Central de Val√®ncia is a vibrant and historic market housed in a stunning Modernista building adorned with colorful tiles. It is one of the oldest food markets in Europe, offering an authentic glimpse into daily life in Valencia. The market boasts a diverse collection of stalls, each separated by type, where locals shop for regional produce such as live eels, various prawn varieties, and giant hams.

sources.snippet: The Central Market, also known as Mercado Central, is a bustling indoor market located in the heart of Valencia, Spain. It is one of the largest markets in Europe and one of Valencia‚Äôs most iconic landmarks, attracting both locals and tourists alike. The market was built in 1928 and is housed in an impressive Art Nouveau building with a steel-and-glass roof, giving it a modern and airy feel.
sources.shortName: Looking for romantic things to do in Valencia?

sources.snippet: The Central Market is a display of Valencia's modernist architecture. With construction dating back to 1914, the building has been recently refurbished, displaying an impressive entry and colourful ceramic tiles. Enjoy a guided visit to the Central Market or another neighbourhood market, with a local chef, on our Valencia Market Visit and Paella Class.
sources.shortName: Valencia, Spain - Old Town and historic sights

places.name: Central Market of Valencia

reviews.text:
A functional place where you can find everything in terms of food and drink. I love marketplaces.
In this mercado, you can get a single serving of paella in plastic containers from the stalls inside. When in Valencia, having paella is a must. A portion costs around 5‚Äì6 euros. I had the original chicken version - with saffron and its special rice, it was an excellent taste. Definitely try it. I can't say anything about the seafood version because I didn't dare to try it :)

This is a spectacular market situated right in the centre of town offering food, fruits, meats, dried fruits & nuts and lot more especially the various varieties of freshly cooked Paella!
The place is very clean, well looked after and well managed.

Beautiful market hall with lots of variety. Mostly food, but also some souvenirs. The atmosphere is lively and the building itself is stunning. It was quite warm inside, so I hesitated to try the meat, but still a great place to visit!

places.address: Ciutat Vella, 46001 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Ciudad de las Artes y las Ciencias is a cutting-edge science complex located in a beautifully landscaped park. It features a large aquarium, an IMAX cinema, and various cultural and scientific institutions.

sources.shortName: Best of the best - Top romantic restaurants in Valencia

places.name: Ciudad de las Artes y las Ciencias

reviews.text: This place was extremely gorgeous. It is such a nice place to take pictures outside! The museum itself has so much to learn about, and has surveys you can take to help improve it. We had a great time and would've spent longer had we had more time. I recommend buying tickets to the Hemisphere show as well. We saw the Amazon show and it was great. We even saw baby chicks hatch inside!!!

The architecture is amazing and is covered in nature. You can even see and hear parrots in the trees and it's beautiful. It's a brilliant place to walk around and explore but one thing which wasn't the best was the cost to go inside. I read other reviews and some people said how it isn't worth paying the money to go inside and I can agree with them. If you want to, your more than welcome to pay the money to go inside but I wouldn't. Overall, amazing place to go and there's a bus which goes right up to the museum which was very helpful.

A brilliant museum both inside and out. Very easy to get tickets with a ticketing machine on the way in which gives you all the different ticket options and optional extras. The museum had 3 floors, one dedicated to science / space, the other 2 were arts and medicine. Very interesting exhibitions, many of which interactive and fun. Definitely worth a visit!

places.address: Quatre Carreres, 46013 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Bioparc Valencia is a unique zoo that houses nearly a thousand animals from 150 different African species. The park features specially designed habitats to ensure the well-being and comfort of the animals, offering visitors an immersive experience in various natural habitats. From vast savannas to dense forests, visitors can observe antelopes, giraffes, rhinoceroses, hyenas, buffaloes, leopards, gorillas, and elephants in recreated wild environments.

sources.snippet: For nature-loving couples, Bioparc Valencia offers a unique opportunity to experience the beauty of wildlife up close. This zoo features a more naturalistic design, where animals roam freely in environments that resemble their natural habitats. It‚Äôs a wonderful place for couples to explore together and connect over their love for nature.
sources.shortName: Romantic spots to celebrate Valentine¬¥s Day in Valencia! ‚Äì Euroace

sources.snippet: It covers an area of 25 acres and houses close to a thousand animals of 150 different African species. The Bioparc is split into four main areas. The dry Savannah, the Wetlands, the recreated Baobab forest and The island of Madagascar.
sources.shortName: 17 Fantastic Things To Do In Valencia, Spain

places.name: Bioparc Valencia

reviews.text:
The best zoo I have every been! I spent a whole day just walking and enjoying animals. The whole park is very good planned, animals are close like lemurs hanging over heads. There is a lot of places to seat and rest and just watch animals playing or making their daily activities. The zoo imitates the natural habitat of animals, there is a lot of caves, waterfalls, animals are not separated in caves or an limited area, so it's such a great experience to see them together and happy.

I highly recommend to buy tickets online to skip the queue. Also there is one restaurant, for menu of day (19 euro) you can have a soup, main dish, dessert and drinks. The restaurant has a beautiful terrace so you can eat watching animals.

Definitely I will come back!

So much fun! Only ¬£25 each for adults. Purchased online the day before and didn't have to line up like the rest. Able to just walk in. The enclosures were so nicely done, clean and the animals appeared well looked after. Would recommend the hippo feeding which is free to watch. The bird show is something I wouldn't rave about and if you're short on time give it a miss. Otherwise so fun. They have an open enclosure where the lemurs reside.

It was the best zoo I even been too. The major reason is the respect they provided for the animals . You can feel that they were happy. The staff can speak English . Highly recommend the restaurant then you can just having your meal with giraffes, rhino etc ‚Ä¶ and the meal set is 19.9 with starter ( salad / soup), main , desert / fruit and , drink. What a nice atmosphere with such a price. I love that they didn't overcharge like other theme park ! And they have a lot of animals too Thanks for having me !

places.address: Av. P√≠o Baroja, 3, Campanar, 46015 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Jard√≠ del T√∫ria - Tram VIII is a picturesque park in Valencia that follows the path of a former riverbed, offering a scenic route through the city center. The 9km green space is adorned with orange trees and palm trees, providing a delightful setting for various activities such as picnicking, mini-golf, and skateboarding. Families can hire family trikes to explore this vibrant area which also features Gulliver Park with its giant slides.

sources.shortName: 29+ AMAZING Things To Do In Valencia, Spain: 2025 Guide

sources.snippet: It is one of the largest urban parks in Spain, seeing almost seven million visitors every year. The park makes up nine kilometres of green space, and  stretches the length of R√≠o Turia‚Äôs former course. It is a great place to take part in leisure activities, cycle, or just unwind in the midst of nature.
sources.shortName: 17 Fantastic Things To Do In Valencia, Spain

sources.siteName: Local Photo Tour | Hire Local Photographers for your vacations
sources.shortName: Where To Propose in Valencia: Best Places To Get Engaged
Looking for romantic things to do in Valencia?

places.name: Jard√≠n del Turia

reviews.text: This park is amazing to explore by bike. We visited in May, when many plants and trees were in bloom, and the ride was absolutely breathtaking. The park features dedicated bike lanes, as well as separate paths for walking and running. It's definitely one of my favorite places in Valencia
Stunning park! Not sure if I've seen anything like it - felt like being in a Halo game ü§© shot an interview here for my YT channel and the backdrop was perfect.

Absolutely fantastic place for a walk or just to relax.

This park was created after the river was diverted and what a fantastic idea. The park also houses the City of Arts and Sciences.

It would be criminal to not visit when you are in Valencia. Highly recommend it.

places.address: 46003 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: La Lonja de la Seda de Valencia, also known as the Silk Exchange, is a grandiose building that showcases the city's Medieval wealth through intricate stonework and carvings. It was once a symbol of Valencia's power during its economic boom in the 14th to 16th centuries due to silk production. The Merchant's Hall within the building is considered a magnificent jewel with its unique design featuring columns resembling palm trees and a ceiling meant to evoke a starry sky.

sources.shortName: 29+ AMAZING Things To Do In Valencia, Spain: 2025 Guide

places.name: La Lonja de la Seda de Valencia

reviews.text: A beautiful UNESCO world heritage site in the centre of Val√®ncia. Very helpful staff and considering its UNESCO - there was no queues and no waiting times. We were given the option of an audio guide which we took. Very easy audio equipment to use, including the map, which directs you from around the building and even brings you on the outside of the building too! Would definitely recommend to spend an hour here.

A fascinating structure and unique interior architecture especially the columns in the main hall that support the floor. The ancient trading place mainly for the Silk trading auction and meetings is a great place to visit. The courtyard houses rare plants and orange trees with with seating to relax and enjoy the view.

This place is a piece of history! The architecture is amazing, especially those impressive columns and the ceiling in the big hall. We spent about an hour just wandering around, watching the presentation on the history of this place. It's definitely worth checking out!

places.address: C/ de la Llotja, 2, Ciutat Vella, 46001 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Oceanogr√†fic is a major attraction located within the City of Arts and Sciences in Valencia, Spain. It is Europe's largest marine park, featuring over 20,000 creatures from 650 different species. The aquarium showcases marine life from various ecosystems around the world, offering visitors an immersive experience through its diverse exhibits.

sources.snippet: Visit the City of Arts and Sciences in Valencia with its fantastic Oceanografic that will catapult you into the marine world!. Continue your day along the Turia River Park where you can go for a midday bike ride. This green space runs through the city center and is a perfect way to sightsee.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Valencia

sources.snippet: Oceanogr√†fic is one of the stars of the City of the Arts and Sciences. The aquarium is the largest in Europe, situated on the Turia River bed. It opened in 2003 and contains 45,000 individual animals from 500 different species.
sources.shortName: 17 Fantastic Things To Do In Valencia, Spain

places.name: Oceanogr√†fic Val√®ncia

reviews.text: Beautiful place, with a lot of attractions for both children and adults. I would highly recommend the dolphin representations, absolutely lovely. Place is well organised, and varied in expositions, you can easily spend an entire day and not become bored. Foods and drinks available throughout the complex. There are also souvenir shops with many items you can choose from. There are also options to combine tickets with visit to the Museum of Sciences or Hemispheric Projections. During busy periods, might be recommended to get tickets in advance

Initially we thought it was expensive for entry but I had heard it was very good and wasn't disappointed. The whole experience is excellent. The marine life and conservation projects are first class. Easy access to all areas for wheelchair users and pushchairs, plenty of clean toilets and cafes. The dolphin show is included in the price and is really good. We had a thoroughly good half a day but I am sure if you had children you'd stay longer.

Fabulous, a most enjoyable experience.
Informative and wondrous. It was busy so booking online saved a wait in line.
Paid for the audio guides but barely used them as the written information was very comprehensive.
Had lovely food available for most dietary requirements. Certainly, the flamingo restaurant/ cafe had great some vegan options.
The shark tank was incredible, dolphin show spectacular and the 4D cinema was short but fun.

places.address: C/ d'Eduardo Primo Y√∫fera, 1, Quatre Carreres, 46013 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Cabecera Park, situated at the end of the old Turia River bed in Valencia, offers a serene escape with its green spaces and various attractions. Divided into four parts, including the Bioparc zoo and La Montana Mirador, a small mountain providing picturesque views of the park and lake. Visitors can enjoy walking and biking paths, kids' playgrounds, and even rent rowboats for a leisurely experience.

sources.snippet: From here you can enjoy a beautiful landscape of Valencia and even rent a swan and pedal to make a romantic tour of the lake of the park.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Valencia

places.name: Cabecera Park

reviews.text: I really liked the park. Very large, a place for a picnic. Beautiful nature, animals. Turtles that crawled to the shore, giant fish in the river. Very pleasant impressions and a beautiful sunset ‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞ I recommend visiting

Wonderful landscaped park with Asian and European trees.
At the lake you can rent a pedal boat with the shape of a dragon, swan, flamingo etc.
The small restaurant is great for a coffee or small lunch.
Don't forget to walk up to the top of the hill to enjoy the view.

I was looking  for a place to sleep in my silly hammock as my silly friend didn't understand what day I arrived to Valencia coming from the C of Poland, and couldn't host me that night.

I found the park very welcoming at 2am and I felt safe.
I first tried to set up my hammock on top of the hill in the southeast. However, the wind was strong and there were some Begu already relaxing there.
I then looked for a more sheltered spot on the opposite side of the hill.

It turned out to be a great place, as I was hidden by bushes from early morning joggers and night Begu.
The night was cool (17¬∞) for a silly Begi with no sleeping Begu, but I managed to stay warm enough until the sunrise saved my cold self from turning into ice cubes.

I wasn't woken up by the police in the morning (unlike in Almeria), none of my stuff went missing, and no late-night Begu caused any trouble near my tree.

The sunrise was very pretty. It's a good idea to hang out there early in the morning.

Overall, a great experience-I left to catch a FREEEEE bus at the station 2km east.
Highly recommend spending a night here if you're in a similar situation.
#mosquitofree

places.address: Av. P√≠o Baroja, Campanar, 46015 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Jardins de Montfort is a charming city garden that offers an elegant and peaceful escape from the urban hustle. Designed in the mid-19th century, this under-visited gem features marble statues, ornamental fountains, and a serene goldfish-filled pond in a neoclassical style. Shaded walkways adorned with flowering vines provide relief from the summer heat. The picturesque pavilion at the entrance makes it a popular spot for weddings.

sources.snippet: Another of the romantic places in Valencia that you must visit to get lost with your partner are the Jardines de Monforte , from the 19th century. Its marble statues, vases, different ponds and ornamental fountains make this garden an ideal place for lovers. You will also find beautiful trees, trimmed hedges and flowers that will serve well as a background if you want to impress that day in some beautiful photographs.
sources.shortName: Romantic places in Valencia to get lost with your partner - Casual Hoteles | Web Oficial

sources.snippet: For those looking for a quiet, secluded garden setting, Jardines de Monforte is a hidden gem for a Valencia proposal. This beautiful neoclassical garden features elegant statues, fountains, and well-manicured hedges that create an intimate atmosphere. The garden is considered one of the most beautiful corners of Valencia for good reason and it makes for one of the top spots to get engaged in the city.
sources.siteName: Local Photo Tour | Hire Local Photographers for your vacations
sources.shortName: Where To Propose in Valencia: Best Places To Get Engaged

sources.snippet: Jard√≠n de Monforte is one of Valencia‚Äôs hidden gems ‚Äì an elegant and beautifully landscaped garden located near the city center. The classical design, with statues, fountains, and manicured hedges, creates a mystical environment for couples to escape the noise and crowds of the city. It‚Äôs perfect for a peaceful stroll or a quiet moment to reflect.
sources.shortName: Romantic spots to celebrate Valentine¬¥s Day in Valencia! ‚Äì Euroace

sources.snippet: There are so many romantic things to do in this beautiful city, from taking a sunset stroll through the Jardines de Monforte to exploring the historic and picturesque Barrio del Carmen neighbourhood.
sources.shortName: Finding Romance in Valencia, Spain: Enchanting Spots for Couples

places.name: Jardines de Monforte

reviews.text: An incredibly beautiful park. A quiet and peaceful place where you can enjoy beautiful flowers, the aroma of ripe fruits and the songs of birds.
Pretty place, very small and quiet in the middle of nowhere. There are plenty of naranja trees (not reachable) but the flower tunnel is not always blloming

I'll rate this 3,5/5.

There is barely flower. They have a nice maze tho. I got a few nice photos, took by myself. Oh the entree is weird. You need to make a loop from the beginning of the park. Would be nice if they have back door open.

places.address: C/ de Montforte, S/N, El Pla del Real, 46010 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Metropolitan Cathedral‚ÄìBasilica of the Assumption of Our Lady of Valencia is a stunning Gothic-style cathedral that is renowned for housing the Holy Grail. Visitors can also explore the historic Miguelete tower, which offers panoramic views of the city. The cathedral is located in Valencia's city center, making it easily accessible on foot. Nearby attractions include the Plaza de la Reina, the Silk Exchange, and the Modernist Central Market.

sources.shortName: 29+ AMAZING Things To Do In Valencia, Spain: 2025 Guide

sources.snippet: Valencia's cathedral is an impressive building nestled between two beautiful squares: Plaza de la Reina and the Plaza de la Virgen.
sources.shortName: Valencia, Spain - Old Town and historic sights
Best of the best - Top romantic restaurants in Valencia

places.name: Valencia Cathedral

reviews.text:
Valencia Cathedral ‚Äì A Place of Power, Peace, and History
This is more than just a church - it's a living piece of history in the heart of the city. Built on the site of a former mosque, the cathedral beautifully blends Gothic, Romanesque, Baroque, and even Moorish elements. Every corner tells a different story.

üîî Don't miss the climb to the Miguelete Tower - the panoramic view of Valencia's old town is absolutely breathtaking.

üíé Inside, you'll find one of Christianity's most sacred relics: the Holy Grail, believed by some to be the actual cup used by Jesus during the Last Supper.

üé´ There is an entrance fee, but it's absolutely worth it - the audio guide, stunning interior, and powerful atmosphere make it unforgettable.

Great touristic attraction, well organized by self touring headsets, no need to join groups or guides. Prices are very reasonable and they have offers for families. The facility is accessible for wheelchairs including the museum inside the cathedral.

The Valencia Cathedral is absolutely stunning and a must-see when visiting the city. The architecture is breathtaking, blending Gothic, Romanesque, and Baroque styles, and the interior is filled with beautiful details and history.

One of the highlights is the chapel that houses what is believed to be the Holy Grail, an incredible piece of history that makes the visit even more memorable. Climbing the Miguelete tower is also a must, offering sweeping views over Valencia that are worth every step.

The atmosphere inside is peaceful and awe-inspiring, making it easy to linger and take it all in. A true highlight of Valencia and highly recommended.

places.address: Pl. de l'Almoina, s/n, Ciutat Vella, 46003 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Arrocer√≠a Maribel is a renowned restaurant located in La Albufera, about 6.8 miles south of central Valencia, known for its authentic and delicious paella dishes. The restaurant has received the Michelin Bib Gourmand award and offers a variety of paellas including seafood paella with carabineros, a type of prized scarlet prawns from Spain.

sources.snippet: The first rice restaurant that opened back in 1983, Arrocer√≠a Maribel, has stood the test of time with its excellent selection of paellas and rice dishes in La Albufera. Chef Mar√≠a Jos√© Estevens has created a gastro bar-style menu filled with delicious homemade goodie, where the obvious highlight is the rice dishes. The restaurant is bright and elegant and the ambiance is laid back and relaxed.
sources.shortName: Best of the best - Top romantic restaurants in Valencia

places.name: Arrocer√≠a Maribel

reviews.text: A wonderful lunch! Highly recommend! We ate inside because it was windy and the atmosphere was warm. The meal started out high with warm fresh bread, flavorful garlic aioli and tomato. We wanted to try the eel specialty of this area ‚Äú All i pebre de anguila‚Äù and it was delicious! The sauce was so rich with a hint of spice. The eel was very tender. We saw another table order Paella Mixta (not on the menu) and it was the perfect balance of the classic paella Valenciana and seafood rice dishes. The flavor of traditional paella is so deep but this also had Norwegian lobster, prawns, mussels, and other various shellfish throughout. It was my dad's birthday so we ordered three desserts - horchata cake, chocolate of the world and ice cream. Finished the meal off with complementary digestives and cremaet, of course!

This was our second visit here and we hit the jackpot with ordering this time. They're obviously famous for their paella, but it was the other items that truly stood out. The Calamari was one of, if not THE best, I've had. The breading they use is next level. The tuna and tomato salad was light and fresh and everything we hoped for. The "Paella Mirabel" had great socarrat and the seafood was cooked to perfection.  Just when we thought we couldn't possibly eat another bite, we caved and ordered dessert. Instead of being dense, the cheesecake was light and fluffy and bit reminiscent of a pavlova. We paired it with cremaet and it was the perfect ending to a wonderful lunch. Our waiter was Walter and he was both attentive and charming. Excellent overall experience and we look forward to returning.

Good example of fresh, local, and well prepared food with all the non-rice dishes. We generally like and have cooked paella; however, we didn't like the paella. Not sure if we got a bad batch or if their paella is supposed to be different like that. Tip: Don't get the calamari, it's nothing special if you eat calamari occasionally, more importantly I think it's on the menu to keep people new to seafood happy.

places.address: Carrer de Francisco Monle√≥n, 5, Pobles del Sud, 46012 El Palmar, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Jard√≠ Bot√†nic, located in the historic center of Valencia, is a botanical garden and greenhouse belonging to the University of Valencia. It houses an impressive collection of over 4500 plant species, including exotic flora and palms from around the world. Originally used for cultivating medicinal plants, it now serves as a public space for studying and promoting sustainable use of plant life. Visitors can explore different sections dedicated to various types of vegetation such as fruit and vegetables, medicinal plants, and cacti.

sources.snippet: You‚Äôll be surprised the moment you enter the Botanical Garden of Valencia University because the central space of the main building opens up to let the trees inside grow upwards towards the sky. The garden originally belonging to Valencia University and was used to grow medicinal plants; today it‚Äôs the perfect spot to take a stroll and admire the colourful plants growing in the greenhouse. You‚Äôll find plants species from around the world among its many trees.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Valencia as a couple ‚Äì Barcel√≥ Guides

places.name: Jard√≠n Bot√°nico

reviews.text:
A wonderful and tranquil place to spend an afternoon! I recommend coming on a sunny day. Entry was 4 euros per person on a Sunday.

You could spend 45 minutes to a few hours here! There's many many paths to walk down and lots of different plants to view. As you go deeper, there are greenhouses, fountains, trees, and cactus.

There's seating in the middle but note there is no trees to provide shade so you will be in the direct sun. There was benches along the middle path that are covered by trees but with more foot traffic.

I saw some people sitting and reading and I brought my journal as well.

It's mostly quiet but there are some big groups unfortunately making a lot of noise. The garden is so big though that you can definitely find a spot for peace and quiet.

I highly recommend coming here! I think it's great for all ages.

Great place to be at. A very vast collection of different plants and trees. The parakeets are nesting in different trees, a lot of noise are produced. Easy access 4 euro per person. 10% discount with VTC
A great mid day outing. You can walk and rest under the canopy. Well with the 4 euros/pp. even in a busy time in Valencia there are very few people here. That is worth 75% of the fee.

places.address: C/ de Quart, 80, Extramurs, 46008 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a charming alley near the cathedral, Cafe de las Horas is a must-visit spot in the vibrant El Carmen neighborhood of Valencia. The cafe offers a cozy interior adorned with delightful decor such as cheeky cherubs, elegant chandeliers, and baroque paintings. While they have a small terrace, the real charm lies inside where you can admire the blue ceiling adorned with golden stars and exposed wooden beams.

sources.snippet: Taste the traditional Agua de Valencia at Cafe de las Horas. This eclectic bar hosts poetry readings and theme nights. The night we went it was a diva theme, and we saw everything from cabaret-style clothes to a sultry songstress to an impersonator of Eurovision winner Conchita Wurst.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Romantic Things to Do in Valencia, Spain

sources.snippet: If you prefer something a little more low-key, head to one of the many bars in the historic district, such as Caf√© de las Horas or La Vitti.
sources.shortName: Finding Romance in Valencia, Spain: Enchanting Spots for Couples

places.name: Cafe de las Horas

reviews.text: We came here just to have some drinks and to admire the interior. We were warmly welcomed and they gave us the option to choose at which table to be seated. The staff was nice and kind and also they know English which is a must if you ask me. We had some cocktails which were good just a little bit too expensive. The location looks amazing of course this being the main attraction of it. Overall we recommend this place!

Cafe de las Horas was recommended to me as the best place in town to come and try the famous Agua de Val√®ncia cocktail.
The interiors are decorated in an elegant style, with a few extravagant touches.
We preferred to sit outside, because it was very noisy inside, although you could still talk.
We were given a table straight away without having to wait, but after a short while of being seated there was a bit of a queue.
All the staff members are young, courteous and quick.
I recommend this place for a pre-dinner aperitif or an after dinner drink.

I loved the interior design. At first, I sat outside, but after seeing the pictures, I decided to move inside - and I'm glad I did! The staff were helpful and polite. We tried the rum cake and the walnut cake, and had a cortado and a liqueur coffee. It was my first time trying liqueur coffee, and I found it a bit strong. Other than that, the cakes were delicious and the prices were very reasonable. If you're looking for a nice place to relax, I think it's worth a try.

places.address: C/ del Comte d'Almod√≥var, 1, Ciutat Vella, 46003 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Jardins del Real, also known as Vivers, is a picturesque city park in Valencia with a rich history. Once part of the Royal Palace grounds and home to a tree nursery, it now offers visitors an enchanting landscape featuring palm trees, topiaries, sculptures, and fountains. Adjacent to the Jardines de Viveros is the charming Jardin de Monforte.

sources.snippet: These gardens were once home to the old Palau del Real and there are two small hills that were created from the rubble of the palace that are often chosen by couples as a great spot for selfies. Valencia is a totally flat city and these are therefore the ‚Äúonly two hills in Valencia‚Äù. They‚Äôre known as the Hills of Elio in tribute to General Elio who heroically defended the city during the War of Independence but was decapitated here by his own troops on the orders of Ferdinand VII. This sorry tale isn‚Äôt exactly romantic but that aside, the gardens have a series of different areas that are each beautiful in their own way, such as the lake or rose garden, and are perfect for a romantic walk.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Valencia as a couple ‚Äì Barcel√≥ Guides

sources.snippet: Dating back to the Muslim era, Jardines del Real, also known as Los Viveros, is one of Valencia‚Äôs most historic and romantic gardens. This expansive green oasis is adorned with elegant fountains, fragrant rose gardens, and tranquil pathways, providing countless opportunities for an intimate and memorable proposal.
sources.siteName: Local Photo Tour | Hire Local Photographers for your vacations
sources.shortName: Where To Propose in Valencia: Best Places To Get Engaged

sources.snippet: The Viveros - Jardines del Real are also perfect to visit as a couple. With a great variety of trees, each one more beautiful, plants and flowers, for a moment you will forget that you are in the center of Valencia. Don't forget to walk to the Rose Garden, the bird house or the pond with ducks and swans.
sources.shortName: Romantic places in Valencia to get lost with your partner - Casual Hoteles | Web Oficial

places.name: Jardines del Real / Viveros

reviews.text: Beautiful garden to visit with kids. We stopped to see the peacocks and the docks and our kids were able to run around freely in the large park. Going early in the morning helped because it was nearly empty. Imagine having this place all to yourselves!

Month of may 2025, there is an outdoor exhibit showcasing 50 of the most important (printed) pieces from the Prado museum. The descriptions were very informative and it's a great (free way) to see and learn about these famous art pieces. The rest of the park was great, lots of playgrounds, bird aviary spaces, and more.

Jardines del Real (also known as Viveros) in Valencia is a true green oasis in the heart of the city. Spacious, peaceful, and full of life, the park captivates with its majestic palm trees, lush greenery, and numerous pathways that invite you to take long walks and relax.

It's perfect for picnics, photography, or simply spending the day surrounded by nature, away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Tall trees provide pleasant shade, while the variety of plant species and beautifully arranged flower beds create a stunning, picturesque atmosphere.

The park radiates peace and harmony ‚Äì an ideal place to escape the everyday and enjoy the simplicity of nature.

places.address: C/ del Gral. Elio, s/n, La Sa√Ødia, 46010 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Casa Monta√±a is a historic tavern located in the Cabanyal district of Valencia, dating back to 1836. The charming space, once a sailors' tavern, exudes romantic vibes with its oak wine barrels, art nouveau tiles, and antique bullfighting posters. This hidden gem attracts locals and tourists alike for its refined tapas and extensive wine selection.

sources.snippet: It offers a varied menu with dishes made with the best local products and seasonal ingredients. Ultimately, it proposes preparations that have a seasonal component. Surprise your partner with a high-quality dinner inspired by a variety of flavors: the world of the vegetable garden, the essence of seafood products, a wide selection of cheeses, delicious desserts and very tempting sweets, in addition to many other dishes, make up the menu of Casa Monta√±a.
sources.shortName: Valentine‚Äôs Day in Valencia: 3 Ideas to Surprise Your Partner | Blog

sources.snippet: Tapas for dinner at the historic Casa Monta√±a, a 178-year-old restaurant within walking distance of the beach. This lively neighborhood restaurant has the warm feel of a night out with friends, even if you don't know a soul there. The manager Alejandro speaks four languages and is always ready with a joke, and the sommelier will not steer you wrong with over 1,000 bottles to choose from.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Romantic Things to Do in Valencia, Spain

sources.snippet: If you're looking for something a little more intimate, head to Casa Monta√±a, a charming little restaurant that's located in the historic district and serves delicious tapas and wine.
sources.shortName: Finding Romance in Valencia, Spain: Enchanting Spots for Couples

places.name: Casa Monta√±a

reviews.text: This place is absolutely amazing! Such a great experience. The interior design is very unique. We sat at the bar and ordered some random tapas and house wine. Everything was so tasty. House wine has a unique taste, one of the best wines i have ever tried. Hope to visit here in the future again ‚ù§Ô∏è

We didn't have a reservation, but luck was on our side-we were offered a hidden private room for our group of four! It gave us such a cozy, exclusive dining experience. (A slightly stronger A/C would have made it perfect.)

We chose two tasting menus and added a few extras, and every dish that came out-though small in portion-was beautifully crafted and full of flavor. The sheer variety was impressive, and every single item was excellent.

The service throughout the evening was warm and attentive, making the whole experience even more enjoyable. We had a truly wonderful evening and left with full hearts and happy taste buds. Highly recommended!

The best restaurant in Valencia so far! I arrived without a reservation for a (very) late lunch, and they kindly squeezed me in. The food was absolutely delicious - fresh, made with excellent produce, and cooked to perfection. The ladies in the dining room were friendly and genuinely caring. I felt truly welcomed. I'll definitely be back for more!

places.address: C/ de Josep Benlliure, 69, Poblats Mar√≠tims, 46011 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Palau de la M√∫sica de Val√®ncia is a renowned venue in Valencia, surrounded by a park and gardens, hosting orchestra performances, concerts, and various cultural events. It features an impressive program with orchestras, solo performances, jazz, poetry, flamenco, and more from both local and international artists. The venue has welcomed esteemed musicians like John Scofield, Ron Carter, Joe Lovano, Dave Douglas, Snarky Puppy and Silvia Perez Cruz for its Jazz Festival.

sources.snippet: The magnificent Palau de la Musica (no points for guessing that‚Äôs the Palace of Music) situated in the Turia Gardens is a wonderful place to go on a warm summer‚Äôs evening to take in a live classical or contemporary concert event.
sources.shortName: Immerse in the Romance of Valencia
Looking for romantic things to do in Valencia?

places.name: Palacio de la M√∫sica

reviews.text: The place is amazing. Super bright and with great concerts
Great center of music  surrounded by parks enjoyed by runners, walkers, families, you name it, everyone is in the area. Winter time so more quiet... 4.6 stars

I've been here a couple of times only; once to a kids festival and once to see an orchestra performing soundtracks to famous films.

The venue is nice and well looked after. The kids had a lot of fun and the acts were great. The seats are quite comfortable and the prices aren't bad.

When I went alone, I left at the intermission as the sound reverberating off the wall next to where I was sitting gave me a headache. In my experience, which is only two gigs here, I think the sound is poor for a venue of this size; both in terms of the equipment (or lack of) and the quality of the desk.

I honestly have no idea how so many people could comment on the place having good sound; not my experience at all. Maybe I was just unlucky?!?

places.address: Pg. de l'Albereda, 30, El Pla del Real, 46023 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: If you're looking for a unique flamenco experience in Toronto, La Buler√≠a Tablao Flamenco is the place to go. The intimate setting and high quality performers will leave you with an incredible roller coaster of emotions. The food is mediocre, but the VIP tickets bring nothing special, the service is decent, and the staff is charming.

sources.shortName: Immerse in the Romance of Valencia

places.name: La Buler√≠a Tablao Flamenco

reviews.text: What an unforgettable experience! It wasn't my first time watching flamenco, but the show here completely blew me away. The way the music, songs, and dance all came together created such an emotional performance. I could really feel the passion in the air. We also had dinner, and it was absolutely delicious, the perfect meal to enjoy during the show. The cocktails were fine, but honestly, they were nothing compared to the incredible atmosphere and the stunning performance. Definitely a night I'll remember!

This was a fantastic experience ‚Äì we had VIP seats at the very front of the stage, right in the center. The food was excellent, the service perfect, and the performances were spectacular. They exceeded my expectations on every count ‚Äì the guitarist, the singing, and the three dancers. High energy, skillful, and flamboyant ‚Äì great entertainment. Highly recommend.

Booked a table online. Paid for premium that costs 65‚Ç¨ per person, show included. Really worth the money. Show starts at 10:30 and ends in an hour. Though the room was air conditioned but I suggest bringing your own hand-held fan. Did get a bit warm. I found the restaurant was very dark, low-lit. Thankfully we had a corner table where we got some light from a spot light. The service ladies were friendly and nice. At around 11:45 we could request a taxi through the restaurant. All in all worth a visit.

places.address: Carrer del Bisbe Jaume P√©rez, 24, Quatre Carreres, 46006 Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Pont de les Flors- Alcaldessa Rita Barber√° is a modern landmark in Valencia that features a vibrant display of flowers, which are changed four times a year to ensure constant blooming. Crossing the popular Turia Gardens, this bridge adds an extra burst of color to the city. The picturesque setting resembles something out of Alice in Wonderland, with beautiful flowers and towering Mediterranean Cypress trees creating a peaceful atmosphere for leisurely strolls or bike rides.

sources.snippet: The Puente de las Flores is undoubtedly one of the most romantic spots to propose in Valencia. Designed by renowned Valencian architect Santiago Calatrava, this ‚ÄúBridge of Flowers‚Äù crosses the scenic Turia Gardens and is decorated with 27,000 colorful flowerpots. The vibrant red, orange and pink blooms, combined with a sprinkle of wedding white, create a dreamy, romantic atmosphere, ideal to make the moment truly unforgettable.
sources.siteName: Local Photo Tour | Hire Local Photographers for your vacations
sources.shortName: Where To Propose in Valencia: Best Places To Get Engaged

places.name: Puente de las Flores

reviews.text: This bridge is so vibrant and inviting. It's the perfect spot to take a walk or a few photos. They also put poinsettias up recently for Christmas. If you walk to the end of the bridge towards Center and look to the trees on the right side, you'll also spot some Christmas tree decorations inside the trees there.
One of the many bridges along the old river bed which had been turned into a garden oasis in the city with good cycling and walking routes and resting areas most definitely worth a look
Must visit when you have a walk down the old river place. Beautiful bridge with flowers on both sides for pedestrians!

places.address: Puente de las Flores- Alcaldesa Rita Barber√°, El Pla del Real, 46010 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Caf√© del Duende, located on Carrer del Turia, is a cozy and intimate venue that offers live performances of traditional flamenco music and dancing. The caf√© hosts shows from Thursday to Sunday, featuring talented local singers, guitarists, and dancers. The atmosphere is casual and reflects the local Valencian vibe with simple decor.

sources.shortName: Immerse in the Romance of Valencia

places.name: Caf√© del Duende

reviews.text: We had really good time! Check online the time for the show, be there 1 hour before to book the ticket. You can choose a drink which is included in 18eur price.

My wife, our two children (ages 9 and 17), and I had a wonderful time! The music and dancers were fantastic. Arrive early, as it's a small bar and fills up quickly. Also, bring a small snack to pair with your wine, beer, or other drinks, as they don't offer food. Overall, a great experience!

What an experience!! We were lucky to come across this gem of a place on some website, they have Flamenco shows (daily if i am not mistaken, but you can always call in advance and ask). Amazing show, amazing passionate dancers, wonderful atmosphere. Tip: the place opens at 7:30 to let the guests in, as they do not take reservations and you cannot buy tickets in advance, be there at around 7:00 to queue and get the best spots üëçüèªbut tbh, regardless of where you sit, you will always see the stage.
AMAZING! Highlight of our Valencia Trip ‚ù§Ô∏è

places.address: C/ del T√∫ria, 62, Extramurs, 46008 Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Malvarrosa beach in Valencia is a 1km-long city beach with soft sand and a bustling promenade lined with shops and restaurants. It's a popular spot for sunbathing, strolling along the waterfront, and enjoying outdoor cafes, bars, and clubs during the summer months. Accessible by public transportation, it offers a more relaxed and local atmosphere compared to Las Arenas beach.

sources.snippet: This beachfront restaurant is located right on Malvarrosa Beach and has been a favourite among locals and tourists alike for over a century. With its stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea and delicious seafood dishes, it's the perfect place for a romantic dinner with your partner.
sources.shortName: Finding Romance in Valencia, Spain: Enchanting Spots for Couples

places.name: Malvarrosa beach (Valencia)

reviews.text: Beautiful wide, golden color sandy beach. Water is clean, clean and really warm. Lifeguards on duty. Showers in front of entrance. Really convenient after swim in sea. A lot of parking spots but be aware of black dudes ‚Äúreserving‚Äù spots for you. Avoid them, park in next available spot. Really recommend that beach.

One of the widest beaches I've seen! There's so much space you can play volleyball or football without worrying about bothering anyone. The amount of soft sand is incredible-you could almost build a house with it! It's about an hour's walk from the center, but totally worth it. Just pop in some music and enjoy the stroll like I did. A perfect mix of nature, freedom, and relaxation!
‚ô°‚ô°‚ô°
beautiful. gorgeous. water and sad were amazing. fun crowd. plenty of space for everyone. lots of diff activities in the beach and plenty of shops nearby

places.address: Spain

places.generalDescription: La Anjana is a tapas bar in Valencia with great food and friendly service. It gets busy quickly, so reservations are recommended.

sources.snippet: La Anjana in Valencia In the center of Valencia, in the Eixample district (in the Ruzafa neighborhood) we find La Anjana. La Anjana specializes in Valencian style tapas. The restaurant is cozy and modest, an excellent place to go with friends or family and share a bite to eat and a ‚Äúca√±a‚Äù (beer).
sources.shortName: Best of the best - Top romantic restaurants in Valencia

places.name: La Anjana

reviews.text: I have been here twice in the last month and this is definitely my favourite restaurant so far. The service is amazing, Anna has been a gem both times. The squid and octopus are to die for. This time we also tried the chefs salad which was also very refreshing. Looking forward to returning and trying more of the dishes. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Amazing food and atmosphere. We had sangrias, the grilled squid, grilled octopus, ham & cheese board and the chef's salad - all perfect! Will come back.
We checked local reviews to see what to have for dinner and we weren't disappointed! The tapas was so tasty and the service was amazing! Highly recommend this restaurant

places.address: Carrer dels Vivons, 23, Ensanche, 46006 Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Popular with swimmer & sunbathers, this wide, sandy beach features chair rentals & a promenade.
places.name: Platja de Llevant

reviews.text:
Beautiful! You can feel the Mediterranean Sea.
Even though it's cold but so nice the breeze. Good for a walk on warmer weather and can enjoy the breeze on of the the restaurant or just seating by seaside. Clean area

A vast beach with golden sand lined by the scores of restaurants and small hotels that are facing the beach. The actual beach is quite far walking distance from the restaurants and it's sand all the way until you reach the sea.
The attractions on the beach are non existent and the surrounding area is a bit run down and not well kept.
Really nice beach, with showers to clean yourself from the sand and salt. A bit crowded, but there's lots of space.

places.address: Spain

sources.snippet: One of the best and most elegant option you will find in the Albufera nature park, slightly south of valencia. Everything on the menu is homemade and appetizing, but if you go to El Sequer de Tonica you are there for the rice or the seafood. They offer some of the best paellas you will find and some excellent fish and seafood.
sources.shortName: Best of the best - Top romantic restaurants in Valencia

places.name: Restaurant El Sequer de Tonica

reviews.text: It was very delicious! Also there was an option to sit outside with the dog, they have a tent with a heater.

Food was really good, tasty and fresh. Service took some time though. Shrimps in the rice were really good but were not properly clean. Something that could be definitely improved. House's white wine not amazing. In any case, a great restaurant in a beautiful location in the middle of the rice plantations.
great restaurant with great seafood and Paella. good service and great athmosphere.

places.address: Carrer dels Redolins, 85, Poblados del Sur, 46012 El Palmar, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Fira Val√®ncia is a remarkable venue that caters to a variety of events, from trade fairs to conventions. When planning your visit, especially during peak tourist seasons, it's wise to secure accommodations early. The city offers an array of lodging options, ranging from budget-friendly hostels to charming boutique hotels like the SH Ingles Boutique Hotel for couples seeking a romantic escape or even unique stays on boats at Velero en Puerto de Valencia - E&M Boats.

sources.snippet: When it comes to accommodations, be sure to book well in advance, especially if you're planning to visit during peak tourist season. As we mentioned earlier, there are plenty of options to choose from in Valencia, from affordable hostels to luxurious boutique hotels. SH Ingles Boutique Hotel make for a great couples getaway stay while Velero en Puerto de Valencia - E&M Boats is an accommodation that‚Äôs actually on a boat!
sources.shortName: Finding Romance in Valencia, Spain: Enchanting Spots for Couples

places.name: Feria de Valencia

reviews.text: I loved the whole setup about the exhibition and met different producers of Porcelain Tiles and supplier's. I will definitely go again next year to Feria Valencia
Was here for Marathon Valencia Registration. Great venue, lacks caf√©s inside etc, and not easy to get to. But spacious with ample room to maneuver if at a conference
Visited Fira Valencia Sept 30-Oct 2 and it was a fantastic venue with easy parking and great facilities and showroom floors

places.address: Av. de les Fires, s/n, Pobles de l'Oest, 46035 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain

sources.snippet: Valencia is one of the best cities where you can rent a bicycle for a variety of reasons: the good climate during the whole year, a good connection to the natural areas la Albufera, el Saler and the dry river that has been converted into a beautiful park. This park, the Turia, used to be a river that flowed through the city and caused floods in the past. Therefore, this river has been transformed into a beautiful park so people can enjoy the nature and various sights where Valencia is known for such as Ciudad de las Artes y Las Ciencias.
sources.shortName: Romantic weekend in Valencia: the perfect loving plan

places.name: Pelican Bike Rentals and Tours

reviews.text: The Grand City tour with guide Erica was excellent. Having spent some days in the city we spent most of the tour in the park and then going to the seaside. The bikes were very good and Erica provided a good insight into both the city and the people.

The Pelican Bike Tour was a really fun and informative activity to do in Valencia. We saw a lot of the city and got to know much about the history. A thing I can really recommend for people who wants to learn more about interesting fun facts and want to discover the beautiful parks of Valencia.

If I could give them more than 5 stars I would. Vavina, Dave and a tall gentleman at the later shift had been so helpful and friendly. We were so happy that we came to this Pelican Bike Rental instead of the other one by the ocean. Their attitude were fun and solution solving oriented. I am mobility challenged, hard for me to walk around the city let alone the parks. We wanted to get to a restaurant by the beach and go through the Turia Park. They gave us a ‚Äú long tail cargo bike‚Äù for me to sit at the back instead of a tandem bike. My husband is a cyclist he was so happy to travel the city in a bike with me behind him. We rented the bike for 8 hrs and rode for 6 hrs on and off through Turia park and more. We discovered so much of Valencia through biking around the city and for me to see so much (50km) was beyond my ability. We are so impressed with the infrastructure for Cyclists and scooters in Valencia, world class!
We are planning on our next trip back to Valencia already!  Thank you for making this day so special.

places.address: Carrer de l'Herba, 4, Ciutat Vella, 46003 Val√®ncia, Valencia, Spain
